meanings.definition: To make something dependent on a particular context or perspective.
meanings.sent1: She relativized her opinion based on new information.
meanings.sent2: The scientist relativized the data to account for different variables.
meanings.sent3: The comedian relativized the joke by adding a funny twist.
meanings.sent4: His decision was relativized by the ever-changing circumstances.
meanings.sent5: The artist relativized the colors to create a harmonious painting.

meanings.definition: To consider something in relation to something else.
meanings.sent1: He always relativized his achievements against his goals.
meanings.sent2: The teacher relativized the historical events for better understanding.
meanings.sent3: The children relativized the size of the toy to their imagination.
meanings.sent4: The writer relativized the characters to explore deeper themes.
meanings.sent5: She relativized the flavors to create a balanced meal.
